product_overview: BroLab Entertainment is a modern, responsive music beats marketplace built with React and TypeScript that offers professional audio playback, e-commerce functionality, subscription management, and multi-language support. It integrates Clerk for authentication and billing, Convex for data management, and features advanced UI components for an engaging user experience.
core_goals: Deliver an intuitive and seamless user experience across devices with responsive design and multi-language support.
Ensure secure authentication and subscription billing with Clerk integration.
Provide a comprehensive beats marketplace with advanced filtering, search, and product management capabilities.
Implement a professional audio player with waveform visualization and persistent playback controls.
Enable smooth e-commerce operations including cart management, checkout, and order confirmation workflows.
Support user dashboard for analytics, downloads, profile, and subscription management.
Maintain high performance, accessibility, and security standards compliant with industry best practices.
key_features: Authentication system with Clerk and user synchronization to Convex database.
Complete beats store featuring filtering by genre, BPM, price, and search functionality.
Advanced waveform audio player supporting single and global playback with volume, seeking, and mobile touch controls.
User dashboard offering analytics, order history, downloads, and subscription status.
Shopping cart and checkout flow with Clerk Billing integration, supporting guest and registered users.
Subscription plans: Basic, Artist, Ultimate with billing and quota management.
Service booking system for mixing, mastering, recording sessions, and custom beats requests.
Favorites and wishlist management with recently viewed beats.
Internationalization support with i18next for multiple languages and currency localization.
Performance optimizations such as lazy loading, caching, and code splitting.
Robust error handling, UI component library using Radix UI and shadcn/ui, and responsive navigation layout.
SEO optimization with meta tags and structured data.
Admin panel for content and user management.
Loyalty and rewards program with transaction history.
user_flow_summary: User visits the homepage, navigates using responsive navbar and explores featured beats or searches via filtering options.
User views product details with license selection, previews audio with waveform player, and adds the beat to cart.
User manages shopping cart, updates quantities, and proceeds to checkout with guest or authenticated flows.
Authenticated users can access dashboard to view analytics, downloads, orders, and subscription status.
Users sign up, log in, reset password, and verify email via Clerk authentication workflows.
Users subscribe to plans, manage subscription billing, and view usage quotas.
Users book services such as mixing, mastering, or recording sessions through integrated forms.
Users manage favorites and wishlist, view recently played beats, and receive personalized recommendations.
validation_criteria: All features must work flawlessly across supported browsers: Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge with 100% compatibility.
Performance benchmarks include Lighthouse score above 90, First Contentful Paint under 2 seconds, and 60fps smooth interactions.
Accessibility compliance with WCAG 2.1 AA standards verified through automated and manual testing.
Responsive design verified across defined breakpoints from mobile (320px) to ultrawide (2560px+).
Security validation includes XSS prevention, CSRF protection, secure authentication and session management.
Testing coverage targets: 80%+ unit tests, 70%+ integration tests, 90%+ end-to-end tests with visual regression monitoring.
Audio player must support smooth waveform rendering, playback controls, and persistent playback across navigation.
E-commerce workflows including cart persistence, payment processing via Clerk Billing, and order confirmation must be validated.
Subscription plans and management integrate correctly with billing system and reflect accurate quotas and billing history.
Error handling mechanisms and admin panel functions must operate reliably with no unhandled exceptions.
